data.name: Intro
data.value:
Welcome to DevOpsAssistant! This page explains how each section can help you manage your workflow.

Explore the tools below to review your backlog and generate insights that drive better planning.

data.name: Epics
data.value:
• Load a backlog to visualize Epics and Features.
  • Suggested states appear when parents differ from their children—apply them to keep your hierarchy consistent.

data.name: Validation
data.value:
• Select a backlog and states then check work items against your rules.
  • Tag violations for follow up so nothing slips through the cracks.

data.name: Quality
data.value:
• Generate a detailed prompt to score stories against INVEST and coach using your Definition of Ready.
  • Long prompts are split into parts—use the arrows to navigate.

data.name: RequirementsPlanner
data.value:
• Break wiki pages or uploaded documents into a plan of Epics, Features and Stories, then create work items.
  • Use HTML in descriptions and acceptance criteria when helpful—imported text renders automatically so you can verify markup.

data.name: ReleaseNotes
data.value:
• Select stories and build a prompt that summarizes them for release notes.
  • Prompts can be copied or downloaded in parts—navigate with the arrows.

data.name: BulkTag
data.value: • Choose multiple work items, pick one or more tags, and apply them all at once.

data.name: Metrics
data.value:
• Display throughput, lead time, cycle time, velocity and rolling velocity along with burn up and cumulative flow charts.
  • Throughput counts completed items while lead and cycle time measure Created-to-Closed and Activated-to-Closed respectively.
  • Use the options panel to adjust the rolling window and spot trends.

data.name: BranchHealth
data.value:
• View repository branches and highlight stale branches or ahead/behind counts compared to a base branch.
  • Regular clean up keeps your repo tidy.

data.name: Settings
data.value:
• Configure your DevOps organization, project and PAT in the settings dialog.
  • Custom prompts and validation rules are stored in your browser.
  • Create a PAT with Work Items (Read & write), Wiki (Read) and Code (Read) scopes—see {0} for details.
